ðŸš€ signalbot | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Developing custom automated messaging bots for the Signal platform.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Python package for creating Signal bots â€¢ Minimal example provided for quick setup â€¢ Command registration system â€¢ Integration with signal-cli-rest-api â€¢ Asynchronous command handling
ðŸ“– Summary: Signalbot is a Python micro-framework designed to simplify the creation of custom Signal bots. It allows developers to easily define commands and integrate them with the signal-cli-rest-api to send and receive messages programmatically.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ tlosint-vm | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a ready-to-use virtual machine environment pre-loaded with essential OSINT tools and configurations, or to allow users to easily install and update these tools on their existing Kali/Debian systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Pre-built Kali Linux OSINT VM image (OVA format for VirtualBox and VMware) â€¢ Standalone script (tlosint-tools.sh) for on-demand OSINT tool installation on Kali/Debian
ðŸ“– Summary: The tlosint-vm repository provides a pre-built Kali Linux virtual machine distribution tailored for OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) tasks, based on the Kali VM build scripts. It also offers a standalone script to customize Kali or Debian-based systems with a curated set of OSINT tools and Firefox hardening.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ keeweb | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Securely managing and accessing passwords across different platforms and devices, with compatibility for existing KeePass databases.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Browser and desktop password manager â€¢ Compatible with KeePass `kdbx` files â€¢ Create new password vaults â€¢ Cross-platform support (Linux, Windows, MacOS) â€¢ Cloud storage integration (Dropbox, Google Drive, OneDrive)
ðŸ“– Summary: KeeWeb is a cross-platform password manager that allows users to manage their credentials in `kdbx` files, compatible with KeePass. It can be used as a browser extension or a desktop application, and supports integration with cloud storage services.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ tracee | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring and securing Linux systems and applications at runtime by detecting and reporting on system and security events.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Runtime security monitoring â€¢ Observability using eBPF â€¢ Event generation (system activity and security patterns) â€¢ Docker support â€¢ Kubernetes support
ðŸ“– Summary: Tracee is an open-source eBPF-based tool for Linux runtime security and observability. It monitors system and application behavior, exposing activities as events, including sophisticated security detections of suspicious patterns.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ gitlogue | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Visualizing and replaying Git commit history in a cinematic and animated way within the terminal.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Commit Replay as Animation â€¢ Working Tree Diff View â€¢ Tree-sitter Syntax Highlighting â€¢ Project File Tree â€¢ Screensaver Mode
ðŸ“– Summary: gitlogue is a terminal-based tool that transforms your Git commit history into a cinematic, animated replay. It visualizes code changes with realistic typing animations, syntax highlighting, and file tree transitions, making the evolution of code an engaging visual experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
